extends java.lang.Object
    MyArrays class This class contains tasks about using arrays.

    2020
    Author:
    Dr Suzy Atfield-Cutts adapted from Melanie Coles

      double addUpNumbers​(double num1, double num2, double num3, double num4, double num5)
      addUpNumbers() This method takes a group of doubles and returns the sum of them
      int addUpNumbers​(int[] numbers)
      addUpNumbers() this method takes an array of ints and returns the sum of them
      java.lang.String andTheWinnerIs​(java.lang.String[] names)
      andTheWinnerIs() takes an array of names as an input, creates a random number generator based on the array length the number generated is the index for the array
      double averageOfNumbers​(int[] myNumbers)
      averageOfNumbers() takes an array of ints, calculates the sum and finds the average using the .length method
      int[] convertToCelsius​(int[] fahrenheit)
      convertToCelsius() takes an array of temperatures and puts them through an equation and stores the results in a new array
      java.lang.String[] unitMarks​(int[] grades)
      unitMarks() takes an array storing some grades and puts them into a new array formatted with the unit code and a colon and adds an average at the end

        public double addUpNumbers​(double num1,
                           double num2,
                           double num3,
                           double num4,
                           double num5)
        addUpNumbers() This method takes a group of doubles and returns the sum of them
        Parameters:
        num1 - first number input
        num2 - second number input
        num3 - third number input
        num4 - fourth number input
        num5 - fifth number input
        Returns:
        returns the sum of the numbers

      • addUpNumbers

        public int addUpNumbers​(int[] numbers)
        addUpNumbers() this method takes an array of ints and returns the sum of them
        Parameters:
        numbers - the array storing the numbers
        Returns:
        the sum of the numbers

      • averageOfNumbers

        public double averageOfNumbers​(int[] myNumbers)
        averageOfNumbers() takes an array of ints, calculates the sum and finds the average using the .length method
        Parameters:
        myNumbers - the array storing the numbers
        Returns:
        the average of the numbers

      • convertToCelsius

        public int[] convertToCelsius​(int[] fahrenheit)
        convertToCelsius() takes an array of temperatures and puts them through an equation and stores the results in a new array
        Parameters:
        fahrenheit - the array storing the temperatures runs a for each loop which goes through the temperatures in the array puts the temperature through the conversion equation and adds it to the new array
        Returns:
        the new array

      • unitMarks

        public java.lang.String[] unitMarks​(int[] grades)
        unitMarks() takes an array storing some grades and puts them into a new array formatted with the unit code and a colon and adds an average at the end
        Parameters:
        grades - the array storing the grades a for each loop which cycles through the grades formats the output for the new array using the unit code + : + grades adds this output to the new array adds the grade to a sum variable outside the loop it creates an average variable which is the sum divided by the length method adds the formatted average to the new array
        Returns:
        the new array

      • andTheWinnerIs

        public java.lang.String andTheWinnerIs​(java.lang.String[] names)
        andTheWinnerIs() takes an array of names as an input, creates a random number generator based on the array length the number generated is the index for the array
        Parameters:
        names - the array of names
        Returns:
        the name from index
